metadata.title: CVE-2014-5209 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An Information Disclosure vulnerability exists in NTP 4.2.7p25 private(mode 6/7) messages via a GET_RESTRICT control message, which could let amalicious user obtain sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4
sntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu4').
